verses.verse: (1 He admonisheth the Church to rejoice though it be afflicted.4 For by the righteous Lord it shall be delivered.6 And the enemies for all their glorious show, shall suddenly be destroyed. ) They have oftentimes afflicted me from my youth (may Israel now say)
They have oftentimes afflicted me from my youth: but they could not prevail against me.
The plowers plowed upon my back, and made long furrows.
But the (Because God is righteous, he cannot but plague his adversary, and deliver his, as oxen out of the plough.) righteous Lord hath cut the cords of the wicked.
They that hate Zion, shall be all ashamed and turned backward.

(The enemies that lift themselves most high, and as it were approach near to the Sun, are consumed with the heat of Godâ€™s wrath, because they are not grounded in godly humility.) They shall be as the grass on the house tops, which withereth afore it cometh forth.
Whereof the mower filleth not his hand, neither the gleaner his lap:
(That is, the wicked shall perish, and none shall pass for them.) Neither they which go by, say, The blessing of the Lord be upon you, or, We bless you in the Name of the Lord.
